cure verb [T]
(MAKE WELL)
B2 to make someone with an illness healthy again: At one time doctors couldn't cure TB/cure people of TB.
C1 to solve a problem: The president and his advisors meet this week to discuss how to cure inflation.
More examplesFewer examplesHe made wild claims about being able to cure cancer.Drugs have been developed to cure some duodenal ulcers.Some people try hypnotism to cure themselves of addictions.She tried to cure the pain in my knee by putting manual pressure on the joint.The medicine won't cure her - it merely stops the pain.
